00041 // Note that depending on the device (initiator) you'll use against, this
00042 // emulator it might work or not. Some readers are very strict on responses
00043 // timings, e.g. a Nokia NFC and will drop communication too soon for us.
00044 
00045 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00046 #  include "config.h"
00047 #endif // HAVE_CONFIG_H
00048 
00049 #include <stdio.h>
00050 #include <stdlib.h>
00051 #include <stddef.h>
00052 #include <stdint.h>
00053 #include <string.h>
00054 #include <signal.h>
00055 
00056 #include <nfc/nfc.h>
00057 
00058 #include "utils/nfc-utils.h"
00059 
00060 #define MAX_FRAME_LEN (264)
00061 #define SAK_ISO14443_4_COMPLIANT 0x20
00062 
00063 static uint8_t abtRx[MAX_FRAME_LEN];
00064 static int szRx;
00065 static nfc_context *context;
00066 static nfc_device *pnd;
00067 static bool quiet_output = false;
00068 static bool init_mfc_auth = false;
00069 
00070 static void
00071 intr_hdlr(int sig)
00072 {
00073   (void) sig;
00074   printf("\nQuitting...\n");
00075   if (pnd != NULL) {
00076     nfc_abort_command(pnd);
00077   }
00078   nfc_close(pnd);
00079   nfc_exit(context);
00080   exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00081 }
00082 
00083 static bool
00084 target_io(nfc_target *pnt, const uint8_t *pbtInput, const size_t szInput, uint8_t *pbtOutput, size_t *pszOutput)
00085 {
00086   bool loop = true;
00087   *pszOutput = 0;
00088 
00089   // Show transmitted command
00090   if (!quiet_output) {
00091     printf("    In: ");
00092     print_hex(pbtInput, szInput);
00093   }
00094   if (szInput) {
00095     switch (pbtInput[0]) {
00096       case 0x30: // Mifare read
00097         // block address is in pbtInput[1]
00098         *pszOutput = 15;
00099         strcpy((char *)pbtOutput, "You read block ");
00100         pbtOutput[15] = pbtInput[1];
00101         break;
00102       case 0x50: // HLTA (ISO14443-3)
00103         if (!quiet_output) {
00104           printf("Initiator HLTA me. Bye!\n");
00105         }
00106         loop = false;
00107         break;
00108       case 0x60: // Mifare authA
00109       case 0x61: // Mifare authB
00110         // Let's give back a very random nonce...
00111         *pszOutput = 2;
00112         pbtOutput[0] = 0x12;
00113         pbtOutput[1] = 0x34;
00114         // Next commands will be without CRC
00115         init_mfc_auth = true;
00116         break;
00117       case 0xe0: // RATS (ISO14443-4)
00118         // Send ATS
00119         *pszOutput = pnt->nti.nai.szAtsLen + 1;
00120         pbtOutput[0] = pnt->nti.nai.szAtsLen + 1; // ISO14443-4 says that ATS contains ATS_Length as first byte
00121         if (pnt->nti.nai.szAtsLen) {
00122           memcpy(pbtOutput + 1, pnt->nti.nai.abtAts, pnt->nti.nai.szAtsLen);
00123         }
00124         break;
00125       case 0xc2: // S-block DESELECT
00126         if (!quiet_output) {
00127           printf("Initiator DESELECT me. Bye!\n");
00128         }
00129         loop = false;
00130         break;
00131       default: // Unknown
00132         if (!quiet_output) {
00133           printf("Unknown frame, emulated target abort.\n");
00134         }
00135         loop = false;
00136     }
00137   }
00138   // Show transmitted command
00139   if ((!quiet_output) && *pszOutput) {
00140     printf("    Out: ");
00141     print_hex(pbtOutput, *pszOutput);
00142   }
00143   return loop;
00144 }
00145 
00146 static bool
00147 nfc_target_emulate_tag(nfc_device *dev, nfc_target *pnt)
00148 {
00149   size_t szTx;
00150   uint8_t abtTx[MAX_FRAME_LEN];
00151   bool loop = true;
00152 
00153   if ((szRx = nfc_target_init(dev, pnt, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), 0)) < 0) {
00154     nfc_perror(dev, "nfc_target_init");
00155     return false;
00156   }
00157 
00158   while (loop) {
00159     loop = target_io(pnt, abtRx, (size_t) szRx, abtTx, &szTx);
00160     if (szTx) {
00161       if (nfc_target_send_bytes(dev, abtTx, szTx, 0) < 0) {
00162         nfc_perror(dev, "nfc_target_send_bytes");
00163         return false;
00164       }
00165     }
00166     if (loop) {
00167       if (init_mfc_auth) {
00168         nfc_device_set_property_bool(dev, NP_HANDLE_CRC, false);
00169         init_mfc_auth = false;
00170       }
00171       if ((szRx = nfc_target_receive_bytes(dev, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), 0)) < 0) {
00172         nfc_perror(dev, "nfc_target_receive_bytes");
00173         return false;
00174       }
00175     }
00176   }
00177   return true;
00178 }
00179 
00180 int
00181 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00182 {
00183   (void) argc;
00184   const char *acLibnfcVersion;
00185 
00186 #ifdef WIN32
00187   signal(SIGINT, (void (__cdecl *)(int)) intr_hdlr);
00188 #else
00189   signal(SIGINT, intr_hdlr);
00190 #endif
00191 
00192   nfc_init(&context);
00193   if (context == NULL) {
00194     ERR("Unable to init libnfc (malloc)");
00195     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00196   }
00197 
00198   // Display libnfc version
00199   acLibnfcVersion = nfc_version();
00200   printf("%s uses libnfc %s\n", argv[0], acLibnfcVersion);
00201 
00202   // Try to open the NFC reader
00203   pnd = nfc_open(context, NULL);
00204 
00205   if (pnd == NULL) {
00206     ERR("Unable to open NFC device");
00207     nfc_exit(context);
00208     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00209   }
00210 
00211   printf("NFC device: %s opened\n", nfc_device_get_name(pnd));
00212 
00213   // Notes for ISO14443-A emulated tags:
00214   // * Only short UIDs are supported
00215   //   If your UID is longer it will be truncated
00216   //   Therefore e.g. an UltraLight can only have short UID, which is
00217   //   typically badly handled by readers who still try to send their "0x95"
00218   // * First byte of UID will be masked by 0x08 by the PN53x firmware
00219   //   as security countermeasure against real UID emulation
00220 
00221   // Example of a Mifare Classic Mini
00222   // Note that crypto1 is not implemented in this example
00223   nfc_target nt = {
00224     .nm = {
00225       .nmt = NMT_ISO14443A,
00226       .nbr = NBR_UNDEFINED,
00227     },
00228     .nti = {
00229       .nai = {
00230         .abtAtqa = { 0x00, 0x04 },
00231         .abtUid = { 0x08, 0xab, 0xcd, 0xef },
00232         .btSak = 0x09,
00233         .szUidLen = 4,
00234         .szAtsLen = 0,
00235       },
00236     },
00237   };
00238   /*
00239   // Example of a FeliCa
00240   nfc_target nt = {
00241     .nm = {
00242       .nmt = NMT_FELICA,
00243       .nbr = NBR_UNDEFINED,
00244     },
00245     .nti = {
00246       .nfi = {
00247         .abtId = { 0x01, 0xFE, 0x56, 0x78, 0x9A, 0xBC, 0xDE, 0xFF },
00248         .abtPad = { 0x12, 0x34, 0x56, 0x78, 0x9A, 0xBC, 0xDE, 0xFF },
00249         .abtSysCode = { 0xFF, 0xFF },
00250       },
00251     },
00252   };
00253   */
00254   /*
00255   // Example of a ISO14443-4 (DESfire)
00256   nfc_target nt = {
00257     .nm = {
00258       .nmt = NMT_ISO14443A,
00259       .nbr = NBR_UNDEFINED,
00260     },
00261     .nti = {
00262       .nai = {
00263         abtAtqa = { 0x03, 0x44 },
00264         abtUid = { 0x08, 0xab, 0xcd, 0xef },
00265         btSak = 0x20,
00266         .szUidLen = 4,
00267         .abtAts = { 0x75, 0x77, 0x81, 0x02, 0x80 },
00268         .szAtsLen = 5,
00269       },
00270     },
00271   };
00272   */
00273 
00274   printf("%s will emulate this ISO14443-A tag:\n", argv[0]);
00275   print_nfc_target(&nt, true);
00276 
00277   // Switch off NP_EASY_FRAMING if target is not ISO14443-4
00278   nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, (nt.nti.nai.btSak & SAK_ISO14443_4_COMPLIANT));
00279   printf("NFC device (configured as target) is now emulating the tag, please touch it with a second NFC device (initiator)\n");
00280   if (!nfc_target_emulate_tag(pnd, &nt)) {
00281     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_target_emulate_tag");
00282     nfc_close(pnd);
00283     nfc_exit(context);
00284     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00285   }
00286 
00287   nfc_close(pnd);
00288   nfc_exit(context);
00289   exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00290 }
